_header: Christ that was crucified for sinners unkind
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 310.
Title(s): The Lady who buried the Host
_description: The Lady who buried the Host, a miracle — seventeen 8-line stanzas

CULEe435a.First Lines:
Creyst that was cruciffeyed ffor synys on kyndGyffe me varey happe
                    & gras…
CULEe435a.Last Lines:
…And ȝeff hos gras when we hens wayndeTo recyue owre god
                    yn fforme of bred

CULFf238.First Lines:
Cryst þat was crucyfyed for synners vnkyndeGyf me very happe
                    & tokyn in þys casTo meve of þys mater þat y of
                    myndeClenly to declare god grunt me hys grace…
CULFf238.Last Lines:
…And geue vs grace when we hens wendeTo resceyue oure god in
                    forme of bredd
CULFf238.Attributed Title:
Here foloweþ a good ensaumple of a lady þat was in dyspeyre (f.
                        54rb)
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
CULFf238.Editions:
Hartshorne,  Charles Henry. 
             Ancient Metrical Tales.
         London: W. Pickering, 1829: 134-44.

CULFf548.First Lines:
God þat on the rode was rentGraunt me grace redely to know
                    þe case…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…Soo þat we [ ] at oure endyng[ ] in forme of
                    brede
CULFf548.Note: Variant; portions deleted by damp and chemical treatments.
CULFf548.Editions:
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.” 
         2 vols. Diss. University of Washington, 1969: 300-4.

BLHar3810.First Lines: Cryst þat was crowned with ou[  ] vyses vnkindGrant me gayly to kenne this case…
BLHar3810.Last Lines: …god graunt with all þy blessyng bereþat leveþ in god in forme of brede
BLHar3810.Note:
Phrased differently than other MSS; refrain varies stanza to
                    stanza.
BLHar3810.Editions:
Jordan,  Richard. 
             “Kleinere Dichtungen der Handschrfit Harley 3810.” 
             Englische Studien
         41 (1910): 253-66: 256-61.
